sen.j: 宮道国平（みやじ の くにひら、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代初期の武将、御家人。
sen.e: MIYAJI no Kunihira (year of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), who lived during the early Kamakura period.

MIYAJI no Kunihira (year of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese military commander and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who lived during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 武将→a Japanese military commander"who"の前のカンマは特に必要ないので、削除しました。
sen.e: MIYAJI no Kunihira (year of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese military commander and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who lived during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was Sanemori SAITO's nephew with a different family name.
sen.cmt: 外甥→nephew with a different family nameとしました。
sen.e: He was Sanemori SAITO's nephew with a different family name.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was Sanemori SAITO's nephew with a different family name.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』では、宮六傔仗国平と記載されている。
sen.e: In "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), his name is described as Guriku (宮六) Kenjo (guard attached to a central government official assigned to the region) Kunihira.
sen.cmt: 宮六傔仗国平→Guriku (宮六) Kenjo (guard attached to a central government official assigned to the region) Kunihiraとしました。
sen.e: In the "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), he was described as Guriku Kenjo (guard attached to a central government official assigned to the region) Kunihira.
sen.cmt: 『吾妻鏡』→the "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East)宮六→Guriku（漢字表記は、特に必要ないと解釈し、削除しました。）
sen.e: In the "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), he was described as Guriku Kenjo (guard attached to a central government official assigned to the region) Kunihira.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宮道氏は、物部氏庶流ともヤマトタケル末裔とも伝えられる氏族であるが、国平の系譜関係は不明である。
sen.e: It is said that the Miyaji clan was a branch family of the Mononobe clan or a family descended from Yamato Takeru (no mikoto), however, the detailed genealogy related to Kunihira is unknown.
Although it is told that the Miyaji clan was a branch family of the Mononobe clan or a family descended from Yamato Takeru (no mikoto), the detailed genealogy related to Kunihira is unknown.
sen.cmt: （である）が、→Although（"although"で始まる文章に変更しました。）
sen.e: Although it is told that the Miyaji clan was a branch family of the Mononobe clan or a family descended from Yamato Takeru (no mikoto), the detailed genealogy related to Kunihira is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方で実盛の弟、実員の子とする系図があることから、本姓藤原氏の斎藤氏の一族とする見解もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, there remains a genealogy indicating that he was the son of Sanekazu, Sanemori's younger brother, and based on this, some theories consider that he was a member of the Saito clan whose honsei (main name) was Fujiwara.
sen.cmt: 藤原氏→Fujiwaraとしました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, some people say that he was a member of the Saito clan whose real family name was Fujiwara because there remains a genealogy indicating that he was the son of Sanekazu, Sanemori's younger brother.
sen.cmt: 本姓→real family name
sen.e: Meanwhile, some people say that he was a member of the Saito clan whose real family name was Fujiwara because there remains a genealogy indicating that he was the son of Sanekazu, Sanemori's younger brother.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 実盛に付き従い治承・寿永の乱で伊勢平氏方であったが、平家滅亡の後、囚人として上総広常に、1183年（寿永2年）に広常が謀殺された後は中原親能に預けられた。
sen.e: In the Jisho-Juei War, he supported the Ise Heishi (Taira clan), following Sanemori, however, after the fall of the Taira clan, he was in confinement under Hirotsune KAZUSA as a captive, and after Hirotsune was assassinated in 1183, he was under the custody of NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi.

Although he followed Sanemori and supported the Ise Heishi (Taira clan) in the Jisho-Juei War, he was taken prisoner by Hirotsune KAZUSA after the fall of the Taira clan, and was in the custody of NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi after Hirotsune was assassinated in 1183.
sen.cmt: ～であったが、→Although（althoughで始まる文章に変更しました。）囚人として→taken prisoner（「囚われの身となって」として、英訳を変更しました。）預けられた→in the custody of（熟語の前置詞は"in"となるので、訂正しました。）
sen.e: Although he followed Sanemori and supported the Ise Heishi (Taira clan) in the Jisho-Juei War, he was taken prisoner by Hirotsune KAZUSA after the fall of the Taira clan, and was in the custody of NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi after Hirotsune was assassinated in 1183.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後勇敢さを見込まれ、親能の養子大友能直付きとなった。
sen.e: Afterwards, recognized for his bravery, he was picked up to serve Chikayoshi's adopted son, Yoshinao OTOMO as the attendant.
sen.cmt: 直付き→the attendantとしました。
sen.e: Thereafter, he was appointed an attendant to Chikayoshi's adopted son, Yoshinao OTOMO, in expectation of his bravery.
sen.cmt: 勇敢さを見込まれ→in expectation of his bravery（「勇敢さに期待して」と同じ意味なので、熟語を使うことにより、簡潔な表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: Thereafter, he was appointed an attendant to Chikayoshi's adopted son, Yoshinao OTOMO, in expectation of his bravery.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1189年（文治5年）の奥州合戦に従軍し戦功により陸奥国に所領を与えられ、1190年（文治6年）の大河兼任の乱に際しても出陣している。
sen.e: In 1189 he took part in the Battle of Oshu, and for his distinguished service in the battle he was given a territory in Mutsu Province, and when the Rebellion of Kaneto Okawa broke out in 1190, he also went to the front.

Kunihira who took part in the Battle of Oshu in 1189 was given a territory in Mutsu Province due to his distinguished service in such Battle, and he also departed for the front when the Rebellion of Kaneto Okawa broke out in 1190.
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞を使用し、文章を簡潔にするため、主語を"Kunihira"としました。出陣する→depart for the front（departureの動詞形を使用しました。）
sen.e: Kunihira who took part in the Battle of Oshu in 1189 was given a territory in Mutsu Province due to his distinguished service in such Battle, and he also departed for the front when the Rebellion of Kaneto Okawa broke out in 1190.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』では、1191年（建久2年）に奥州より牛を献上したとの記事を最後に登場しなくなる。
sen.e: In the Azuma Kagami, his last appearance was in an article in which he presented a cow (to the shogun) from Oshu (Mutsu Province) in 1191.
sen.cmt: 『吾妻鏡』→the Azuma Kagami献上した→presented (to the shogun)としました。
sen.e: In the "Azuma Kagami," he made no appearance in articles after the article of presenting a cow (to the shogun) from Oshu (Mutsu Province) in 1191.
sen.cmt: 『吾妻鏡』→the "Azuma Kagami"（二重括弧でくくられているので、クォーテーションマークを付けました。）
sen.e: In the "Azuma Kagami," he made no appearance in articles after the article of presenting a cow (to the shogun) from Oshu (Mutsu Province) in 1191.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方、実盛死後に武蔵国幡羅郡長井庄（現埼玉県熊谷市）を継ぎ、実盛創建に係る聖天山歓喜院（埼玉県熊谷市）に十一面観音と御正躰錫杖頭を寄進したことが同院の縁起に見える。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the history of Shotenzan Kangi-in Temple (Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture), there is a story that he took over the estate of Nagainosho in Hatara Country, Musashi Province (present Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) after Sanemori's death, and donated to the temple, the foundation of which was associated with Sanemori, a statue of Eleven-faced Kannon and Mishotai shakujo gashira (a head of a priest's pewter staff considered as the principal object of worship).
sen.cmt: 御正躰錫杖頭 (みしょうたいしゃくじょうがしら)→Mishotai shakujo gashira (a head of a priest's pewter staff considered as the principal object of worship)としました。
sen.e: However, the history of Shotenzan Kangi-in Temple (located in present-day Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) relating to the foundation of Sanemori showed that he took over the estate of Nagainosho in Hatara County, Musashi Province (present-day Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) after Sanemori's death, and donated to such Temple a statue of Eleven-faced Kannon and Mishotai shakujo gashira (a head of a priest's pewter staff considered as the principal object of worship).
sen.cmt: 幡羅郡→Hatara County（対訳においても"Hatara Country"と表記されておりますが、"County"の誤記なので、訂正しました。）（現埼玉県熊谷市）→(present-day Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture)（「現」を"present-day"としました。）実盛創建に係る聖天山歓喜院→Shotenzan Kangi-in Temple (Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) relating to the foundation of Sanemori（原文によると、実盛創建に係るのは歓喜院なので、語順を変更しました。）縁起に見える→the history ～ showed（文章を簡潔にするため、変更しました。）
sen.e: However, the history of Shotenzan Kangi-in Temple (located in present-day Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) relating to the foundation of Sanemori showed that he took over the estate of Nagainosho in Hatara County, Musashi Province (present-day Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture) after Sanemori's death, and donated to such Temple a statue of Eleven-faced Kannon and Mishotai shakujo gashira (a head of a priest's pewter staff considered as the principal object of worship).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、嶽六所神社境内外社（秋田県大仙市）には中原親能と連名の棟札が現存していることから、奥州だけでなく出羽国山本郡 (出羽国)にも所領をもっていた可能性が高い。
sen.e: In addition, judging from the fact that the gesha (shrine unregistered in Engishiki laws) located inside the precincts of Dakerokusho-jinja Shrine (Daisen City, Akita Prefecture) still has a munafuda (historical plaque on a building) with his name and NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi's, it is highly probable that he had territories not only in Oshu (Mutsu Province) but also in Yamamoto Country of Dewa Province.
sen.cmt: 境内外社→the gesha (shrine unregistered in Engishiki laws) located inside the precincts of (a temple)としました。
sen.e: In addition, judging from the fact that the gesha (shrine unregistered in Engishiki laws) located inside the precincts of Dakerokusho-jinja Shrine (Daisen City, Akita Prefecture) still has a munafuda (historical plaque on a building) with his name and NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi's, it is highly probable that he had territories not only in Oshu (Mutsu Province) but also in Yamamoto County of Dewa Province.
sen.cmt: 山本郡→Yamamoto County（ミススペルを訂正しました。）
sen.e: In addition, judging from the fact that the gesha (shrine unregistered in Engishiki laws) located inside the precincts of Dakerokusho-jinja Shrine (Daisen City, Akita Prefecture) still has a munafuda (historical plaque on a building) with his name and NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi's, it is highly probable that he had territories not only in Oshu (Mutsu Province) but also in Yamamoto County of Dewa Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
